_header: And save this flower which is our king
Subjects: France, war in (1492); historical verse; occasional verse
_description: A song for victory in France, A.D. 1492 — five irregular quatrains and burden: ‘Te Rosse wolle into frawnse spryng / Almythy god hym thyder bryng’

BLCottDomXVIII.First Lines:
And save thys flowere wyche ys owre kyngWyche ys callyd a nobyll
                    thyng…
BLCottDomXVIII.Last Lines:
…Swet setn Iorge owr ladys knyteSave kyng hary bothe be day
                    & nyȝth
